Handmaiden of [[Varda]] | location= | affiliation=[[Varda]] | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Ilmarë''' was one of the chiefs of the [[Maiar]], and the handmaiden to Queen [[Varda]]. She is only mentioned briefly in the ''[[Valaquenta]]'', where Ilmarë is described along with the Maia [[Eönwë]] who was the banner-bearer and herald of King [[Manwë]].{{S|IIc}} == Etymology == Her name may be related to one of the [[Quenya]] words for "Starlight".{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "[[GIL]]" Christopher Tolkien has noted that ''Ilmarë'' is related to such words as ''[[Ilmen]]'' and ''[[Ilmarin]]''.{{S|Elements}}, entry ''ilm-'' == Other versions of the legendarium == According to the early stages of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', the character that would become Ilmarë was called '''Erinti'''. She was the daughter of [[Manwë]] and Varda, but the concept of the Valar having [[Valarindi|children]] was abandoned and Ilmarë became Varda's handmaiden.{{LT1|II}}, p. 58 She appears in the ''[[Qenyaqetsa]]'', in a rejected early entry. There she is described as: {{quote|the [[Valier|Vali]] of love, music, beauty and purity, who is the same as ''Lotisse'' (or ''Veneste''). She dwells in [[Alalminóre]], and the fairies guard her tower. She and [[Salmar|Noldorin]], and his brother [[Amillo]], alone have left [[Valinor|Valinóre]] to dwell among the Inweli, Noldor, Eldar, and Teleri in [[Tol Eressea]] (Inwenóre). She is also often called ''Akairis'', or bride. She dwells in a "[[korin]]" of elms.|''The [[Qenya Lexicon]]'', entry '''ERE- & ESE'''}}{{PE|12}}, p. 36 But, as [[Christopher Tolkien]] points out, her dwelling in Tol Eressëa in a ''korin'' was eventually taken over by the character of [[Meril-i-Turinqi]], and Erinti became the daughter of Manwë and Varda.{{LT1|Appendix}}, pp. 251-252 === Early etymology === The name '''''Erinti''''' is in [[Qenya]], but its meaning is unclear.{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1984107439.html|articlename=Q. ''Ilmarë'' f.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 March 2022}} She was also called '''''Lotessë''''' (or '''''Lotissë'''''), being comprised of Qenya ''[[lóte]]'' ("flower") and the feminine suffix ''-ssë''.{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2128296051.html|articlename=ᴱQ. ''Lotesse'' f.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 March 2022}} Another one of her names was '''''Akairis''''' (simply meaning "bride" in Qenya). Among her earlier, rejected names was '''''Helinyetillë''''' (glossed as "Eyes of Heartsease"{{PE|12}}, p. 39), a combination of Qenya ''[[helin]]'' ("pansy") and some variation of ''[[yéta]]-'' ("look at"), later used as a name for [[Nessa]].{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2992988903.html|articlename=ᴱQ. ''Helinyetille'' f.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 March 2022}} An early, likewise rejected name '''''Venestë''''' appears next to ''Lotesse'' in the Qenya Lexicon, but its meaning is unclear. === Early genealogy === {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | MAN |y| VAR |MAN=[[Manwë]]|VAR=[[Varda]]}} {{familytree | |,|-|^|-|.| |}} {{familytree | FIO | | ERI |FIO=[[Fionwë]]|ERI='''ERINTI'''}} {{familytree/end}} {{references}} {{ainur}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ilmare}} [[Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales]] [[Category:Characters in The Silmarillion]] [[Category:Maiar]] [[Category:Quenya names]] [[Category:Valarindi]] [[de:Ilmare]] [[fi:Ilmarë]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/ainur/maiar/ilmare]]
